p: Different authors have concluded that the antimicrobial activity of oregano EO is attributed to its hydrophobic phenolic compounds [ 36, 37, 38], which interact with phospholipids that are present in the cell membrane. The results obtained ( Table 3) indicated that P. longiflora EO showed better biological activity against Gram-positive bacteria than Gram-negative bacteria. Similar results were obtained by different researchers for O. vulgare EO [ 39, 40, 41, 42, 43, 44]. The higher resistance of Gram-negative bacteria to EO is attributed, in part, to the complexity of the double cell membrane present, in contrast to the structure of Gram-positive bacteria [ 45].
